Trial_Design.evidence: A randomized crossover trial was conducted involving emergency physicians (EPs) and trainees.

Intervention.evidence: Participants performed both techniques in succession on an airway model, with the technique performed first being randomized for each participant.

Objective.evidence: The objective of this study was to compare the surgical technique using bougie and ETT with an open technique using the Melker catheter.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was time to first insufflation of the artificial lung.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: the technique performed first being randomized for each participant.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The Melker catheter technique was performed quicker with a mean time of 29.2 s versus 44.3 s for the bougie/ETT technique (difference 15.1 s, 95% confidence interval 10.8–19.4 s).
